hero.headline: How to Get Your First 1000 Subscribers
hero.subheadline: The hardest milestone. Here's how to reach monetization faster.

sections.content: The first 1000 subscribers is YouTube's hardest milestone—you're building from zero with no momentum. But it's also the most important, unlocking monetization and proving your channel concept works. Here's the focused strategy to get there faster.

content.title: Monetization Unlock
content.description: 1000 subs + 4000 watch hours = Partner Program eligibility.

content.title: Algorithm Momentum
content.description: YouTube starts recommending your content more seriously.

content.title: Social Proof
content.description: 4-digit subscriber count looks established to new viewers.

sections.title: Fastest Path to 1000
content: Study top 5 channels in your niche
Ask for subscribers in every video

content.title: Target Search Terms
content.description: New channels win in search before browse. Answer questions.

content.title: Trending + Niche
content.description: Apply trends to your niche. Ride momentum while staying relevant.

content.title: Consistent Schedule
content.description: Weekly minimum. Algorithm and audience expect reliability.

content.title: Iterate Fast
content.description: Improve each video. First 30 videos are learning phase.

faq.question: How long does 1000 subscribers take?
faq.answer: Varies wildly—3 months to 2+ years depending on niche, content quality, and consistency. Average is 12-18 months. Some viral channels hit it in weeks.

faq.question: Should I buy subscribers?
faq.answer: Absolutely not. Fake subscribers don't watch, destroying your engagement rate. YouTube can detect and penalize. Kills channel long-term.

faq.question: What if growth stalls?
faq.answer: Analyze what's working—double down on successful topics. Improve thumbnails and titles. Try different content types. The plateau is normal.

faq.question: Is niche more important than quality?
faq.answer: Both matter, but niche first. Perfect videos in oversaturated niches struggle. Good videos in underserved niches grow. Find your gap.
